rationale: The submitted medical records do not establish the medical necessity of skilled nursing facility (SNF) services. There was no documentation of significant changes in the patient’s condition, medication, or treatment plan. The patient care needs were chronic and custodial, and skilled therapy was not required to establish a maintenance program or prevent deterioration in active daily living. Therefore, the services at issue were not medically necessary for treatment of the patient’s medical condition.
reviewer_credentials: Board certified in internal medicine with sub-specialty certification in geriatric medicine, actively practicing, and an expert in the treatment of the enrollee’s medical condition.
